abstract.en:
The full set of equations of motion for the classical water wave problem in Eulerian co-ordinates is obtained from a Lagrangian function which equals the pressure. This Lagrangian is compared with the more usual expression formed from kinetic minus potential energy.

An expression for the pressure has been used (Clebsch 1859; Hargreaves 1908; Bateman 1944) as the Lagrangian when the equations of motion in an inviscid, incompressible fluid are derived from a variational principle, but it seems not to have been explicitly indicated that a simple extension of this variational principle also provides the boundary conditions appropriate to a free surface. This extension is important in the application to water wave problems, where the non-linear boundary conditions for the free surface are the primary concern. The formulation below is also related to that given by Friedrichs (1933) and Garabedian & Spencer (1952), who used a variational principle to obtain the pressure condition at the free surface in steady flows. The present interest in variational principles for water waves and related problems arose from their use by Whitham (1965, 1966) in the theory of non-linear dispersive waves.
abstract.zh:
从拉格朗日函数等于压力的变分原理中，获得了欧拉坐标系下经典水波问题的完整运动方程组。该拉格朗日量与更常见的动能减势能表达式进行了比较。

在推导无粘性、不可压缩流体运动方程的变分原理时，压力表达式已被用作拉格朗日量（Clebsch 1859；Hargreaves 1908；Bateman 1944），但似乎未明确指出该变分原理的简单扩展也提供了适用于自由表面的边界条件。这一扩展在水波问题应用中至关重要，其中自由表面的非线性边界条件是主要关注点。以下公式也与 Friedrichs（1933）和 Garabedian & Spencer（1952）给出的方法相关，他们使用变分原理获得了稳态流动中自由表面的压力条件。当前对水波及相关问题变分原理的兴趣源于 Whitham（1965, 1966）在非线性色散波理论中的应用。

en.content: Bateman further generalized the variational principle to barotropic flow, that is, to flows in which the pressure is a function of the density alone. To extend his results to free surfaces it is again merely necessary to include the surface elevation among the quantities to be varied.

zh.content: Bateman 进一步将变分原理推广到正压流动，即压力仅是密度函数的流动。要将他的结果扩展到自由表面，只需再次将表面高程包含在待变分的量中。
